intro: Lithocarpus rhabdostachyus subsp. eurhabdostachyus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces hard, woody fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical,革质, and have a glossy surface. The subspecies is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
